value: is just 6 miles (10 km) east of the town on Highway 86 and is informative and interesting.  You can see the old ruts from the wagon trains on the hills near the museum. The Center is a National Historic Site and there is an entrance fee although National Park passes may be used here.
.  This is the southern end of the Hells Canyon Scenic Highway which follows Rte 86 east of town to the Snake River on the
border.  The Scenic drive can be followed as a big loop around to

further to the north.  Be aware that driving the entire loop may not be possible during winter as some roads are not maintained and can be blocked by snow.  This situation may exist well into spring (ie: late April).  Some of the roads traverse high terrain where winter snows may linger longer than you might expect.
File:Baker City House (Baker County, Oregon scenic images) (bakDA0104).jpg
.  The town has numerous restored older buildings and there is a walking route around the downtown featuring many of these fine old structures.
.  A wonderful drive through the Elkhorn Mountains just outside of Baker City.  It follows Highway 7 to
and around to Haines past Anthony Lakes Ski Area and the North Fork John Day River Wilderness. This route is also often tough in Winter.
.  Some of the most powdery ski conditions in Oregon and is just 35 miles from Baker City.
The Powder River and Phillips Reservoir
.  Great fishing opportunities both in Baker City and nearby.

content=Miners Jubilee is an annual festival in July that features a parade, bull and bronc riding, a showing of the movie Paint Your Wagons (filmed in Baker City), gold panning championships, and other exciting events.
content=Little kitchen store with enormous wine selection, gifts, coffee bar, kitchen gadgets and more.
has excellent craft beers and good food.
content=Gourmet pizzas, huge stromboli, over 65 different toppings, excellent salads, over 30 beers available, TVs, sports.
content=Great coffee shop in a historic downtown building.
content=Beautifully decorated historic home and condo available for rent. www.BakerCityVacationRentals.com
content=Great historic hotel.  Also has a stellar restaurant and bar.

The Baker County Library located near the downtown has Internet access with wireless capabilities.  The Library is well-appointed and an attractive place to spend some time.
